page.title: 02FISHING WITH THE "CONTEST"
page.content: The boat leaves the pier and steams for sometimes 4 hours before getting to the fishing grounds.Then they turn on the meter that tells them if there are fish in the area , what depth the sea is and whether the sea-bed is rocky or not.Then they throw out the rope and buoy shooting the net fixed to the rope while steaming in a circle .When they return to the buoy it and the rope end are taken aboard. The boat then steams for maybe 4 hours before'heaving',pulling in the net.The net ropes are winched in using the power block when they get to the net. The net is swung aboard by the derrick lowered through a hatch in the shelter deck and then the fish emptied aboard by opening the end of the net. While the net is shot again the fish aboard is gutted,washed,sorted,iced and boxed .Fish may be landed Tuesday and Friday
